meanings.definition: A person who is opposed to something.
meanings.sent1: The aginners at the meeting disagreed with the new policy.
meanings.sent2: She always listens to the aginners' opinions before making a decision.
meanings.sent3: The aginners in the group made sure their voices were heard.
meanings.sent4: The aginners stood firm in their beliefs, despite the opposition.
meanings.sent5: The aginners' presence was felt throughout the debate.

meanings.sent1: He stood aginners the idea of cutting down the old trees.
meanings.sent2: The team worked tirelessly aginners the rival team.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat aginners the dog, refusing to move.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds loomed aginners the bright blue sky.
meanings.sent5: The protesters marched aginners the unfair law.

meanings.definition: To be against or opposed to something.
meanings.sent1: She aginners any form of discrimination in the workplace.
meanings.sent2: The community aginners the construction of the new highway.
meanings.sent3: The children playfully aginners bedtime every night.
meanings.sent4: His heart aginners the idea of leaving his hometown.
